publication.abstract: In this article we describe a new Bioconductor package 'CALIB' for normalization of two-color microarray data. This approach is based on the measurements of external controls and estimates an absolute target level for each gene and condition pair, as opposed to working with log-ratios as a relative measure of expression. Moreover, this method makes no assumptions regarding the distribution of gene expression divergence. Â© The Author 2007. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.
publication.title: CALIB: A Bioconductor package for estimating absolute expression levels from two-color microarray data

summary.description: This package contains functions for normalizing spotted microarray data, based on a physically motivated calibration model. The model parameters and error distributions are estimated from external control spikes.
summary.name: CALIB
